intro: Disperma angolense, commonly known as the Angola disperma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in shrubland and forest edges, preferring well-drained soils. Disperma angolense is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
